title: Mohammad Mosaddegh
summary: Mohammad Mosaddegh[lower-alpha 1] (Persian: محمد مصدق‎, IPA: [mohæmˈmæd(-e) mosædˈdeq] (listen);[lower-alpha 2] 16 June 1882 – 5 March 1967) was an Iranian politician who served as the 35th Prime Minister of Iran, holding office from 1951 until 1953, when his government was overthrown in the 1953 Iranian coup d'état orchestrated by the United Kingdom's MI6.[4][5]
